column4: howdy again..just installed hoary and I went to install 'gftp' and its telling me: gftp depends on gftp-gtk 2.017+cvsblahblah and gftp-text which is not going to be installed ...I added the extra repositories so that surely isn't it...anyone seen this error with hoary ? ;-))
you know that there is a built-in ftp-client in metacity/gnome?
no I had no idea..whats it calle
if its not gui based i'm not interested
just open a folder and select "Connect to server.." from the File-menu.
this isn't working well
and what do you mean open a folder ????
I need to connect to my host and download files that I need...
do you have icons on your desktop?
just open one of them
you don't have a menu item in the "Files"-menu that says something like "Connect to server"?
yes I'm well beyond that point
well, ftp.blah.org ... is probably down...
k I got it
I wasn't seeing the ftp with login connect option is all
got it thx
good.
gftp is faster to get up and going with but in a pinch this is ok
anyway though..is my inability to install gftp via synaptic ( resulting apt-get error) due to simply using hoary atm ?
I have no idea. is gftp a ubuntu-package from universe or main?
not sure
